title: The Walking Dead's Ryan Hurst says Beta could be a well-known celeb
text:
Beta’s true identity is a mystery to viewers (Picture: AMC)

The identity of Whisperer Beta on The Walking Dead is an enduring mystery – his real identity hidden through the flesh mask of his dead best friend.

But Ryan Hurst, who plays the character, has revealed that viewers may recognise the true face behind the mask.

Beta is a member of the Whisperers, a cult of apocalypse survivors who wear the skin of zombies to pass as the living dead. In the show, the mask-wearing enigma is second-in-command to the leader of the sect, Alpha (Samantha Morton).

Hurst revealed to companion show The Talking Dead, however, that his character’s true face could be easily recognisable to viewers.

‘I can’t say too much,’ the actor reveals. ‘All I can say at this point is maybe Beta was a large personality in the world before the apocalypse, and that sort of letting go of that might have been tragic to his psyche. I can’t say much more than that.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

The Sons of Anarchy star had previously joked to Entertainment Weekly that Beta’s true face was a ‘bleary resemblance to Whoopi Goldberg,’ so we could be in for a real shock if and when his true face is revealed in season 10.

As ever, though, The Walking Dead comic book itself did reveal who was behind the mask – a famous basketball player whom the survivors recognise from car commercials.

Beta’s relationship with Whisperer leader Alpha could be tested in the new season (Picture: AMC)

At this point, however, the show has digressed from the comics on so many pivotal moments we don’t know for sure if this will happen on-screen, or whether the producers have surprise casting announcement under their sleeve.

In other zombie apocalypse based news, we’re still reeling from the introduction of Gemma (Thora Birch) in the newest episode of the show.

And could Carol and Daryl actually leave The Walking Dead together in a blaze of glory? Say it isn’t so!

The Walking Dead season 10 continues Sunday in the US, with episodes releasing Mondays on Fox in the UK.

description: On The Walking Dead, Beta's true face is hidden by a flesh mask and Ryan Hurst has hinted that the character's true face could be that of a celebrity
